verses.arabic: الم
verses.english: Alif, Lam, Meem.
verses.transliteration: Alif-Lām-Mīm.

verses.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ الْكِتَابُ لَا رَيْبَ ۛ فِيهِ ۛ هُدًۭى لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.english: This is the Book about which there is no doubt, a guidance for those conscious of Allah.
verses.transliteration: Ḏālika l-kitābu lā rayba fīhi, hudan lil-muttaqīn.

verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْغَيْبِ وَيُقِيمُونَ الصَّلَاةَ وَمِمَّا رَزَقْنَاهُمْ يُنفِقُونَ
verses.english: Who believe in the unseen, establish prayer, and spend out of what We have provided for them.
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna yu'minūna bil-ghaybi wa yuqīmūna aṣ-ṣalata wa mimmā razaqnāhum yunfiqūn.

verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِمَا أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ وَمَا أُنزِلَ مِن قَبْلِكَ وَبِالْآخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ
verses.english: And those who believe in what has been revealed to you, and what was revealed before you, and in the Hereafter they are certain.
verses.transliteration: Wa alladhīna yu’minūna bimā unzila ilayka wa mā unzila min qablika wa bil-ākhirati hum yūqinūn.

verses.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓـئِكَ عَلَىٰ هُدًۭ مٍّ مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ ۖ ۖ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓـئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ
verses.english: It is they who are upon guidance from their Lord, and it is they who will be successful.
verses.transliteration: Ūlā'ika ʿalā ḥudāin min rabbihim wa ulā'ika humu l-muf'liḥūn.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْهِمْ أَأَنذَرْتَهُمْ أَمْ لَمْ تُنذِرْهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.english: Indeed, those who disbelieve — it is the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them — they will not believe.
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna kafarū sawāʾun ʿalayhim ʾa-ʾanḏar'tahum ʾam lam tunḏir'hum lā yu'minūn.

verses.arabic: خَتَمَ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ ۖ وَعَلَىٰ سَمْعِهِمْ ۖ وَعَلَىٰ أَبْصَارِهِمْ غِشَاوَةٌ ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.english: Allah has set a seal upon their hearts and their hearing, and over their eyes is a veil. For them is a great punishment.
verses.transliteration: Khatama llāhu ʿala qulubihim wa ʿala samʿihim wa ʿala ʾabṣārihim ʾighishāwah, wa lahum ʿadhābun ʾaẓīmun.

verses.arabic: وَمِنَ النَّاسِ مَن يَقُولُ آمَنَّا بِاللَّهِ وَبِالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ وَمَا هُم بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: And among the people are some who say, "We believe in Allah and the Last Day," but they are not believers.
verses.transliteration: Wa mina an-nāsi man yaqūlu āmannā billāhi wa bil-ʾākhirati wa hum ʾahum bi-lā yū'minūn.

verses.arabic: يَخَادَعُونَ اللَّهَ وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَمَا يَخْدَعُونَ إِلَّا أَنفُسَهُمْ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.english: They try to deceive Allah and those who believe, but they only deceive themselves without perceiving it.
verses.transliteration: Yakhāḍaʿūna llāha wa alladhīna āmanū wa mā yakhdaʿūna ʾillā ʾanfusahum wa mā yashʿurūn.

verses.arabic: صُدُّوا۟ عَنْ سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۖ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌۭ فَظِيعٌۭ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَكْذِبُونَ
verses.english: In their hearts is a disease, and Allah increases their disease. For them is a painful punishment because they lie.
verses.transliteration: Suddu ʿan sabilillāhi wa lahum ʿadhābun ḍabīḥun bimā kānū yakdhibūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَا تُفْسِدُوا۟ فِى الْأَرْضِ قَالُوا۟ إِنَّمَا نَحْنُ مُصْلِحُونَ
verses.english: When it is said to them, "Do not spread corruption on the earth," they say, "We are only reformers."
verses.transliteration: Wa ʾith qīla lahum lā tufsidu fī l-arḍi qāla ʾinnā maḥnu l-muṣ'liḥūn.

verses.arabic: أَلَا إِنَّهُمْ هُمُ الْمُفْسِدُونَ وَلَٰكِن لَّا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.english: Unquestionably, it is they who are the corruptors, but they perceive it not.
verses.transliteration: Alā ʾinnahum humu l-muf'sidūn wa-lākin la yashʿurūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ آمِنُوا۟ كَمَا آمَنَ النَّاسُ قَالُوا۟ أَنُؤْمِنُ كَمَا أَمَنَ السُّفَهَاءُ ۗ أَلَا إِنَّهُمْ هُمُ السُّفَهَاءُ وَلَٰكِن لَّا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.english: When it is said to them, "Believe as others have believed," they say, "Should we believe as fools believe?" Unquestionably, they are the fools, but they do not know.
verses.transliteration: Wa ʾith qīla lahum āminū kamā āmana an-nāsu qālu ʾa-naʾminu kamā āmana as-sufahāʾu; ʾalā ʾinnahum humu as-sufahāʾu wa-lākin la yaʿlamūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا لَقُوا۟ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا۟ قَالُوا۟ آمَنَّا ۖ وَإِذَا خَلَوْا۟ إِلَىٰ شَيَاطِينِهِمْ قَالُوا۟ إِنَّا مَعَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا نَحْنُ مُسْتَهْزِئُونَ
verses.english: When they meet the believers, they say, "We believe"; but when they go alone with their devils, they say, "Indeed, we are with you; we were only mocking."
verses.transliteration: Wa ʾithā laqaw alladhīna āmanū qālu āmanā, wa ʾithā khalaw ʾilā shayāṭīnihim qālu ʾinnā maʿakum ʾinnamā naḥnu mustahziʾūn.

verses.arabic: اللَّهُ يَسْتَهْزِئُ بِهِمْ وَيَمُدُّهُمْ فِي طُغْيَانِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
verses.english: Allah mocks them and prolongs them in their transgression, wandering blindly.
verses.transliteration: Allāhu yastaḥziʾu bīhim wa yamudduhum fī ṭugh'yānihim yaʿmaḥūn.

verses.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ الَّذِينَ اشْتَرَوُا۟ الضَّلَالَةَ بِالْهُدَىٰ فَمَا رَبِحَت تِّجَارَتُهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ مُهْتَدِينَ
verses.english: It is they who have bought misguidance at the price of guidance, and their trade has brought no profit, nor are they guided.
verses.transliteration: Ūlāʾika alladhīna is'taraw aṣ-ḍalālah bi l-hudā, fa-mā raḥiḥat tijāratuhum wa mā kānū muhtadīn.

verses.arabic: مَثَلُهُمْ كَمَثَلِ الَّذِي اسْتَوْقَدَ نَارًا فَلَمَّا أَضَاءَتْ مَا حَوْلَهُ ذَهَبَ اللَّهُ بِنُورِهِمْ وَتَرَكَهُمْ فِي ظُلُمَاتٍ لَّا يُبْصِرُونَ
verses.english: Their example is like that of a man who kindled a fire, and when it illuminated what was around him, Allah took away their light and left them in darkness, unable to see.
verses.transliteration: Mathaluhum kamathali alladhī istaqada naran, falamma ʾaḍāʾat mā ḥawlahu ḏahaba llāhu binūrihum wa tarakahum fī ẓulumatin lā yub'ṣirūn.

verses.arabic: صُمٌّۭ بُكْمٌ عُمْيٌ فَهُمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ
verses.english: They are deaf, dumb, and blind, so they will not return.
verses.transliteration: Ṣummun buk'mun ʿum'yun fa-hum lā yarjiʿūn.

verses.arabic: أَوْ كَصَيِّبٍ مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ فِيهِ ظُلُمَاتٌۭ وَرَعْدٌۭ وَبَرْقٌۭ يَجْعَلُونَ أَصَابِعَهُمْ فِى آذَانِهِم مِّنَ الصَّوَاعِقِ حَذَرَ الْمَوْتِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ مُحِيطٌۭ بِالْكَافِرِينَ
verses.english: Or like rain pouring from the sky, filled with darkness, thunder, and lightning, they put their fingers in their ears to block out the thunderclap, fearing death. Allah encompasses the disbelievers.
verses.transliteration: ʾawka ṣaybin min as-samāʾ fīhi ẓulumatun wa raʿdun wa barq, yajʿalūna aṣābīʿahum fī ʾādhanihim mina aṣ-ṣawāʾiqi ḥadharan al-mawt, wa llāhu muḥīṭun bil-kāfirīn.

verses.arabic: يَكَادُ الْبَرْقُ يَخْطَفُ أَبْصَارَهُمْ ۖ كُلَّمَا أَضَاءَ لَهُم مَّشَوْا فِيهِ وَإِذَا أَظْلَمَ عَلَيْهِمْ قَامُوا ۚ وَلَوْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ لَذَهَبَ بِسَمْعِهِمْ وَأَبْصَارِهِمْ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.english: The lightning almost snatches away their eyesight. Whenever it flashes, they walk in its light, but when darkness covers them, they stand still. If Allah willed, He could take away their hearing and sight. Surely, Allah has power over everything.
verses.transliteration: Yakaḍu al-baraqu yakhṭifu ʾabṣārahum, kulla mā ḍāʾa lahum mashaw fīhi wa ʾidā ʾaẓlama ʿalayhim qāmū, wa law shāʾa llāhu laḏahaba biṣamʿihim wa ʾabṣārihim, ʾinna llāha ʿalā kulli shayin qadīr.

verses.arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ اعْبُدُوا رَبَّكُمُ الَّذِي خَلَقَكُمْ وَالَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَّقُونَ
verses.english: O mankind, worship your Lord, who created you and those before you, so that you may become mindful of Him.
verses.transliteration: Yā ʾayyuha n-nāsu ʿbudū rabbakumu alladhī khalaqakum wa alladhīna min qabilikum laʿallakum tattaqūn.

verses.arabic: اللَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ فِرَاشًا وَالسَّمَاءَ بِنَاءً وَأَنزَلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَخْرَجَ بِهِ مِنَ الثَّمَرَاتِ رِزْقًا لَّكُمْ ۖ فَلَا تَجْعَلُوا لِلَّهِ أَندَادًا وَأَنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.english: Who made the earth a bed for you, the sky a canopy, and sends forth rain from the skies that fruits may grow -- your food and sustenance. So, do not make another the equal of God knowingly.
verses.transliteration: Alladhī jaʿala lakumu l-arḍa firāshan wa as-samāʾa bināʾan wa ʾanzala mina as-samāi māʾan fa-ʾakhraja bihi mina ath-thamarāti rizqan lakum, fa-lā tajʿalū li-llāhi ʾandādan wa ʾantum taʿlamūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِن كُنتُم فِي رَيْبٍ مِّمَّا نَزَّلْنَا عَلَىٰ عَبْدِنَا فَأْتُوا بِسُورَةٍ مِّن مِّثْلِهِ وَادْعُوا شُهَدَاءَكُم مِّن دُونِ اللَّهِ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.english: And if you are in doubt of what We have revealed to Our votary, then bring a Surah like this, and call any witness, apart from God, you like, if you are truthful.
verses.transliteration: Wa-in kuntum fī raybin mimmā nazzalnā ʿalā ʿabdinā fa-ʾtū bi-sur'atim min mit'lihi wa-ʾidʿū shuhadāʾakum min dūni llāhi in kuntum ṣādiqīn.

verses.arabic: فَإِن لَّمْ تَفْعَلُوا وَلَن تَفْعَلُوا فَاتَّقُوا النَّارَ الَّتِي وَقُودُهَا النَّاسُ وَالْحِجَارَةُ ۖ أُعِدَّتْ لِلْكَافِرِينَ
verses.english: But if you cannot, as indeed you cannot, then guard yourselves against the Fire whose fuel is men and rocks, which has been prepared for the infidels.
verses.transliteration: Fa-in lam tafʿalū wa-lan tafʿalū fa-ittaqū n-naar al-latī waqūduhā an-nāsu wa l-ḥijāra ʾuʿidat lil-kāfirīn.

verses.arabic: وَبَشِّرِ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ الصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ ۚ أَنَّ لَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ۖ كُلَّمَا رُزِقُوا۟ مِنْهَا مِن ثَمَرَةٍۢ رِّزْقًا ۙ قَالُوا۟ هَـٰذَا الَّذِى رُزِقْنَا مِن قَبْلُ ۖ وَأُتُوا۟ بِهِۦ مُتَشَـٰبِهًۭا ۖ وَلَهُمْ فِيهَا أَزْوَاجٌۭ مُطَهَّرَةٌۭ وَهُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
verses.english: And give glad tidings to those who believe and do good deeds, that they will have gardens beneath which rivers flow. Whenever they are provided with fruits therefrom, they will say, "This is what we were given before," and they will be given similar fruits, and they will have pure spouses, and they will abide therein forever.
verses.transliteration: Wa bashshiri alladhīna ʾāmanū wa ʿamilū aṣ-ṣāliḥāti ʾanna lahum jannātin tajrī min taḥtihā l-anharu kulla mā rūziqū min'hā min thamaratin rizqan qālū hādhā alladhī rūziqnā min qabl wa-ʾutū bihi muṭahharan wa-hum fīhā khālidūn.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَسْتَحْيِي أَن يَضْرِبَ مَثَلًا مَّا بَعُوضَةً فَمَا فَوْقَهَا ۚ فَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا فَيَعْلَمُونَ أَنَّهُ الْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّهِمْ ۖ وَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فَيَقُولُونَ مَاذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلًا ۘ يُضِلُّ بِهِ كَثِيرًا وَيَهْدِي بِهِ كَثِيرًا ۚ وَمَا يُضِلُّ بِهِ إِلَّا الْفَاسِقِينَ
verses.english: Allah is not ashamed to give an example, even of a mosquito or anything beyond that. As for those who believe, they know that it is the truth from their Lord; but as for those who disbelieve, they say, "What does Allah intend by this parable?" He misleads many by it and guides many by it. But He does not mislead except the defiantly disobedient.
verses.transliteration: Inna llāha lā yastaḥyī ʾan yaḍriba mathalan mimmā baʿūḍatin fa-mā fawqahā, fa-ʾammā alladhīna ʾāmanū fayʿlamūna ʾannahu l-ḥaqqu min rabbihim, wa-ʾammā alladhīna kafarū faqālū ʾadhā līllāhi bādhā mathalan, yuḍillu bihi kathīran wa-yahdī bihi kathīran, wa-mā yuḍillu bihi ʾillā l-fāsiqīn.

verses.arabic: اللَّذِينَ يَنقُضُونَ عَهْدَ اللَّهِ مِن بَعْدِ مِيثَاقِهِ وَيَقْطَعُونَ مَا أَمَرَ اللَّهُ بِهِ أَن يُوصَلَ وَيُفْسِدُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ الْخَـٰسِرُونَ
verses.english: Those who break the covenant of Allah after having established it, and sever what Allah has commanded to be joined, and spread corruption in the land—those are the losers.
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna yanquḍūna ʿahda llāhi min baʿdi mīthāqihi wa yaqaṭaʿūna mā ʾaṣara llāhu ʾan ʾuyuṣala wa yuf'sidūna fī l-arḍi, ʾulāʾika humu l-khāsirūn.

verses.arabic: كَيْفَ تَكْفُرُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَكُنتُمْ أَمْوَاتًا فَأَحْيَاكُمْ ۖ ثُمَّ يُمِيتُكُمْ ثُمَّ يُحْيِيكُمْ ثُمَّ إِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.english: How can you disbelieve in Allah when you were dead and He gave you life? Then He will cause you to die, then bring you back to life, and to Him you will return.
verses.transliteration: Kayfa takfurūna bi-llāhi wa-ʾantum ʾamwātun fa-ʾaḥyākum thumma yumītukum thumma yuḥyīkum wa-ʾilayhi turjaʿūn.

verses.arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ لَكُم مَّا فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ اسْتَوَىٰ إِلَى السَّمَاءِ فَسَوَّاهُنَّ سَبْعَ سَمَاوَاتٍ ۚ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
verses.english: It is He who created for you all that is on the earth. Then He turned to the heaven and made them seven heavens, and He is knowing of all things.
verses.transliteration: Huwa alladhī khalaqa lakum mā fī l-arḍi jamīʿan thumma istawā ʾilā as-samāi fa-sawwāhunna sabʿa samāwātin wa-huwa bī kulli shayʾin ʿalīm.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ إِنِّي جَاعِلٌ فِي الْأَرْضِ خَلِيفَةً ۖ قَالُوا أَتَجْعَلُ فِيهَا مَن يُفْسِدُ فِيهَا وَيَسْفِكُ الدِّمَاءَ وَنَحْنُ نُسَبِّحُ بِحَمْدِكَ وَنُقَدِّسُ لَكَ ۖ قَالَ إِنِّي أَعْلَمُ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.english: And when your Lord said to the angels, 'I am placing a successor on earth,' they said, 'Will You place therein one who makes mischief and sheds blood, while we glorify Your praise and sanctify You?' Allah said, 'Indeed, I know what you do not know.'
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ qāla rabbuka lil-malāʾikati ʾinnī jāʿilun fī l-arḍi khalīfatan qālū ʾatajʿalu fīhā man yufsidu fīhā wa yasfiku d-dimāʾa wa ḥunā nusabbiḥu ḥamdaka wa nūqaddisu laka, qāla ʾinnī ʾaʿlamu mā lā taʿlamūn.

verses.arabic: وَعَلَّمَ آدَمَ الْأَسْمَاءَ كُلَّهَا ثُمَّ عَرَضَهُمْ عَلَى الْمَلَائِكَةِ فَقَالَ أَنبِئُونِي بِأَسْمَاءِ هَؤُلَاءِ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.english: And He taught Adam the names—all of them. Then He displayed them to the angels and said, 'Tell Me the names of these, if you are truthful.'
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʿallama ʾĀdamu l-asmāʾa kullahā thumma ʿaraḍahum ʿala l-malāʾikati faqāla ʾanbiʾūnī bi-asmāʾi hāʾulāʾi ʾin kuntum ṣādiqīn.

verses.arabic: قَالُوا سُبْحَانَكَ لَا عِلْمَ لَنَا إِلَّا مَا عَلَّمْتَنَا ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الْعَلِيمُ الْحَكِيمُ
verses.english: They said, 'Glory be to You; we have no knowledge except what You have taught us. Indeed, it is You who is the Knowing, the Wise.'
verses.transliteration: Qālū subḥānakā lā ʿilma lanā ʾillā mā ʿallamtanā, ʾinna ʾanta l-ʿalīmu l-ḥakīmu.

verses.arabic: قَالَ يَا ʾآدَمُ أَنبِئْهُم بِأَسْمَائِهِمْ ۖ فَلَمَّا أَنبَأَهُم بِأَسْمَائِهِمْ قَالَ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ إِنِّى أَعْلَمُ غَيْبَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَأَعْلَمُ مَا تُبْدُونَ وَمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْتُمُونَ
verses.english: He said, 'O Adam, inform them of their names.' When he had informed them of their names, He said, 'Did I not tell you that I know the unseen aspects of the heavens and the earth? And I know what you reveal and what you conceal.'
verses.transliteration: Qāla yā ʾĀdamu ʾanbiʾhum bi-asmāʾihim, fa-ʾlamā ʾanbāhum bi-asmāʾihim qāla ʾalam ʾāqul lakum ʾinnī ʾalamu ghayba as-samāwāti wa-l-arḍi wa-ʾaʿlamu mā tubdūna wa-mā kuntum tuktumūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَائِكَةِ اسْجُدُوا لِآدَمَ فَسَجَدُوا إِلَّا إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰ وَاسْتَكْبَرَ وَكَانَ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ
verses.english: And when We said to the angels, 'Prostrate before Adam,' they all prostrated except Iblis. He refused and was arrogant and became among the disbelievers.
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ qulnā lil-malāʾikati ʾisjudū li-ʾĀdam, fasajadū ʾillā ʾIblīsa ʾabā wa-ʾastakbara wa-ʾkāna minal-kāfirīn.

verses.arabic: وَقُلْنَا يَا ʾآدَمُ اسْكُنْ أَنتَ وَزَوْجُكَ الْجَنَّةَ وَكُلَا مِنْهَا رَغَدًا حَيْثُ شِئْتُمَا وَلَا تَقْرَبَا هَٰذِهِ الشَّجَرَةَ فَتَكُونَا مِنَ الظَّـٰلِمِينَ
verses.english: And We said, 'O Adam, dwell you and your wife in Paradise, and eat from wherever you wish, but do not approach this tree, lest you become among the wrongdoers.'
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾqulna yā ʾĀdamu ʾuskun ʾanta wa-zawjuka l-jannata wa-ʾakulā min'hā ṭāʾiʿan ḥaythu šiʾtumā wa-lā taqrabā hādhihi sh-shajaratā fa-taṣūnā mina l-ʾālimīn.

verses.arabic: فَأَزَلَّهُمَا الشَّيْطَانُ عَنْهَا فَأَخْرَجَهُمَا مِمَّا كَانَا فِيهِ ۖ وَقُلْنَا اهْبِطُوا بَعْضُكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ عَدُوٌّ ۖ وَلَكُمْ فِى الْأَرْضِ مُسْتَقَرٌّۭ وَمَتَاعٌۭ إِلَىٰ حِينٍ
verses.english: Then Satan caused them to slip from the paradise and got them expelled from what they were in. And We said, 'Descend, some of you are enemies to others; and for you on the earth is a dwelling-place and enjoyment for a time.'
verses.transliteration: Fa-ʾazallahumā sh-shayṭānu ʿanhā fa-akhrajahumā mimmā kānā fīh, wa-ʾqulna ʾiḍhābū baʿḍu ʾaḍʿū bun li-ʾaḍʿū, wa-lakum fī l-arḍi mustaqarrun wa-ṭāʿun ilā ḥīnin.

verses.arabic: فَتَلَقَّىٰٓ ʾآدَمُ مِن رَّبِّهِ كَلِمَـٰتٍ فَتَابَ عَلَيْهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ التَّوَّابُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.english: Then Adam received words from his Lord, and He accepted his repentance. Indeed, He is the Accepting of Repentance, the Merciful.
verses.transliteration: Fa-talaqqā ʾĀdamu min rabbihi kalimātin fataḅa ʿalayh, ʾinna huwa ʾt-tawwābu r-raḥīmu.

verses.arabic: قُلْنَا اهْبِطُوا مِنْهَا جَمِيعًا ۖ فَإِمَّا يَأْتِيَنَّكُم مِّنِّي هُدًۭى فَمَن تَبِعَ هُدَايَ فَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
verses.english: We said, 'Descend from it, all of you. And when guidance comes to you from Me, whoever follows My guidance will have nothing to fear, nor will they grieve.'
verses.transliteration: Qulnā ʾiḍhābū min'hā jamīʿan, fa-ʾimma yaʾtiyyanakum minī ʾhudā fa-man ittiʿā ʾhudāya fala khawfun ʿalayhim wa-lā hum yaḥzanūn.

verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَكَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَابُ النَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
verses.english: But those who disbelieve and deny Our signs—they are the companions of the Fire, in it they will abide forever.
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhīna kafarū wa kadhdhabū bi-āyātinā ʾulāʾika aṣḥābu an-nāri hum fīhā khālidūn.

verses.arabic: يَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ اذْكُرُوا نِعْمَتِيَ الَّتِي أَنْعَمْتُ عَلَيْكُمْ وَأَوْفُوا بِعَهْدِي أُوفِ بِعَهْدِكُمْ وَإِيَّايَ فَارْهَبُونِ
verses.english: O children of Israel, remember the favors I bestowed upon you. So keep your pledge to Me, and I will keep My pledge to you, and be mindful of Me.
verses.transliteration: Yā banī Isrā'īla uḏkurū niʿmatī allatī anʿamtu ʿalaykum wa-awfū bi-ʿahdī ūfi bi-ʿahdikum wa-iyyāya farhibūn.

verses.arabic: وَآمِنُوا بِمَا أَنزَلْتُ مُصَدِّقًا لِّمَا مَعَكُمْ وَلَا تَكُونُوا أَوَّلَ كَافِرٍ بِهِ ۖ وَلَا تَشْتَرُوا بِآيَاتِي ثَمَنًا قَلِيلًا وَإِيَّايَ فَاتَّقُونِ
verses.english: And believe in what I have sent down, verifying what is already with you; and do not be the first to deny it, nor sell My signs for a small price, and fear Me.
verses.transliteration: Wa-āminū bimā anzaltu muṣaddiqan limā maʿakum walā takūnū awwala kāfirin bihi walā tashtarū bi-āyātī thamanan qalīlan wa-iyyāya fattaqūn.

verses.arabic: وَلَا تَلْبِسُوا الْحَقَّ بِالْبَاطِلِ وَتَكْتُمُوا الْحَقَّ وَأَنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.english: And do not mix the truth with falsehood, nor conceal the truth while you know.
verses.transliteration: Wa-lā tal'busu l-ḥaqba bil-bāṭili wa-taktumū l-ḥaqwa ʾantum taʿlamūn.

verses.arabic: وَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكَاةَ وَارْكَعُوا مَعَ الرَّاكِعِينَ
verses.english: Establish prayer, give zakat, and bow with those who bow.
verses.transliteration: Wa-aqīmū aṣ-ṣalāta wa-ātū az-zakāta wa-rkʿū maʿa ar-rākiʿīn.

verses.arabic: أَتَأْمُرُونَ النَّاسَ بِالْبِرِّ وَتَنسَوْنَ أَنفُسَكُمْ وَأَنتُمْ تَتْلُونَ الْكِتَابَ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.english: Do you command others to do good and forget yourselves while you recite the Scripture? Do you not understand?
verses.transliteration: Ataʾmurūn al-nāsa bil-birri wa-tansawna ʾanfusakum wa-ʾantum tatlūna al-kitāba, ʾafalā taʿqilūn.

verses.arabic: وَاسْتَعِينُوا بِالصَّبْرِ وَالصَّلَاةِ ۚ وَإِنَّهَا لَكَبِيرَةٌ إِلَّا عَلَى الْخَاشِعِينَ
verses.english: Seek help through patience and prayer; and surely, that is a heavy burden except for the humble.
verses.transliteration: Wa-istaʿīnū biṣ-ṣabri wa-ṣalāh, wa-ʾinnahā lakabīratu ʾillā ʿala l-ʿābideen.

verses.arabic: الَّذِينَ يَظُنُّونَ أَنَّهُم مُّلَاقُو رَبِّهِمْ وَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَيْهِ رَاجِعُونَ
verses.english: Those who believe that they will meet their Lord and that they will return to Him.
verses.transliteration: Alladhīna yaẓunnūna ʾannahum mulāqū rabbihim wa-ʾannahum ʾilayhi rājiʿūn.

verses.arabic: يَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ اذْكُرُوا نِعْمَتِيَ الَّتِي أَنْعَمْتُ عَلَيْكُمْ وَأَنِّي فَضَّلْتُكُمْ عَلَى الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.english: O children of Israel, remember My favor which I bestowed upon you, and that I preferred you over all nations.
verses.transliteration: Yā banī ʾIsrāʾīla ʾudh'kuru niʿ'matī ʾalīka wa-ʾannī faḍḍaltukum ʿala l-ʿālamīn.

verses.arabic: وَاتَّقُوا يَوْمًا لَّا تَجْزِي نَفْسٌ عَن نَّفْسٍ شَيْئًا وَلَا يُقْبَلُ مِنْهَا شَفَاعَةٌ وَلَا يُؤْخَذُ مِنْهَا عَدْلٌ وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
verses.english: And fear a Day when no soul will benefit another, nor will intercession be accepted from it, nor will compensation be taken from it, nor will they be helped.
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾattiqū yawman lā tajzi nafsun ʿan nafsin shayʾan wa-lā yuq'balu minhā shafaʿatun wa-lā ʾuk'ẓiḍa min'hā ʿadlun wa-lā hum yunsarūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ نَجَّيْنَاكُم مِّنْ آلِ فِرْعَوْنَ يَسُومُونَكُمْ سُوءَ الْعَذَابِ يُذَبِّحُونَ أَبْنَاءَكُمْ وَيَسْتَحْيُونَ نِسَاءَكُمْ ۚ وَفِي ذَٰلِكُم بَلَاءٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَظِيمٌ
verses.english: And recall when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh, who inflicted severe torment upon you, slaughtering your sons and sparing your women. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ najjaynākum min ʾāli fir'awna yasūmūnakum suʾa l-ʿadhābi yadhabbiḥūna ʾabnāʾakum wa-yastḥyūna nisāʾakum, wa-fī dhālikum balāʾun min rabbikum ʿaẓīmun.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ فَرَقْنَا بِكُمُ الْبَحْرَ فَأَنجَيْنَاكُمْ وَأَغْرَقْنَا آلَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَأَنتُمْ تَنظُرُونَ
verses.english: And remember when We parted the sea for you and saved you, and drowned Pharaoh's people while you watched.
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ faraqnā bīkum al-baḥra fa-ʾanajjaynākum wa-ʾaghraqnā ʾāla fir'awna wa-ʾantum tanẓurūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ وَاعَدْنَا مُوسَىٰ أَرْبَعِينَ لَيْلَةً ثُمَّ اتَّخَذْتُمُ الْعِجْلَ مِن بَعْدِهِ وَأَنتُمْ ظَالِمُونَ
verses.english: And recall when We appointed forty nights for Moses, then you took the calf after him and were wrongdoers.
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ wāʿadnā mūsa ʿārbaʿīna layanatan thumma ʾittakhadhumu l-ʿij'la min baʿdihi wa-ʾantum ẓālimūn.

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ عَفَوْنَا عَنكُم مِّن بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
verses.english: Then We forgave you after that so that you might be grateful.
verses.transliteration: Thumma ʿafawnā ʿankum min baʿdi dhālik li-ʿallakum tashtarīūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ الْكِتَابَ وَالْفُرْقَانَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
verses.english: And recall when We gave Moses the Book and the criterion so that you might be guided.
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ ātaynā mūsa l-kitāba wa-l-fur'qāna li-ʿallakum tahtadūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِ يَا قَوْمِ إِنَّكُمْ ظَلَمْتُمْ أَنفُسَكُم بِاتِّخَاذِكُمُ الْعِجْلَ فَتُوبُوا إِلَىٰ بَارِئِكُمْ فَاقْتُلُوا أَنفُسَكُمْ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ عِنْدَ بَارِئِكُمْ فَتَابَ عَلَيْكُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ التَّوَّابُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.english: And Moses said to his people, 'Indeed, you have wronged yourselves by taking the calf, so repent to your Creator and kill yourselves. That is better for you in the sight of your Creator.' Then He accepted your repentance. Indeed, He is the Most Forgiving, the Most Merciful.
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ qāla mūsa li-qaw'mihi yā qawmi ʾinnakumu ẓalam'tum ʾanfusakum bi-ʾittikhādhikum l-ʿij'la fa-tūbū ʾilā baʾirikum fa-qtulū ʾanfusakum dhālikum khayrun lakum ʿinda baʾirikum fa-tāba ʾalaykum, ʾinnahū huwa t-tawwābu r-raḥīmu.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قُلْتُمْ يَا مُوسَىٰ لَن نُّؤْمِنَ لَكَ حَتَّىٰ نَرَى اللَّهَ جَهْرَةً فَأَخَذَتْكُمُ الصَّاعِقَةُ وَأَنتُمْ تَنظُرُونَ
verses.english: And recall when you said, 'O Moses, we will never believe in you until we see Allah plainly.' Then the lightning struck you while you watched.
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ qul'tum yā mūsa lan nu'mina laka ḥattā nara Allaha ẓuh'ra, fa-ʾaḥaṭṭat'kum aṣ-ṣāʿiqatu wa-ʾantum tanẓurūn.

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ بَعَثْنَاكُم مِّن بَعْدِ مَوْتِكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
verses.english: Then We revived you after your death so that you might be grateful.
verses.transliteration: Thumma baʿathnākum min baʿdi mawtikum li-ʿallakum tashkurūn.

verses.arabic: وَظَلَّلْنَا عَلَيْكُمُ الْغَمَامَ وَأَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكُمُ الْمَنَّ وَالسَّلْوَىٰ ۖ كُلُوا مِن طَيِّبَاتِ مَا رَزَقْنَاكُمْ ۖ وَمَا ظَلَمُونَا وَلَٰكِن كَانُوا أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
verses.english: And We shaded you with clouds and sent down to you manna and quails. Eat of the good things We provided for you. And they harmed no one but themselves.
verses.transliteration: Wa-ẓallalnā ʿalaykumu l-ghamāma wa-anzalnā ʿalaykumu l-manna wa-s-salwa, kulū min ṭayyibāti mā razaqnakum, wa-mā ẓalamūnā wa-lākin kānū ʾanfusahum yaẓlimūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قُلْنَا ادْخُلُوا هَٰذِهِ الْقَرْيَةَ فَكُلُوا مِنْهَا حَيْثُ شِئْتُمْ رَغَدًا وَادْخُلُوا الْبَابَ سُجَّدًا وَقُولُوا حِطَّةٌ نَّغْفِرْ لَكُمْ خَطَايَاكُمْ ۚ وَسَنَزِيدُ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.english: And when We said, 'Enter this town and eat from it freely as you wish, and enter the gate humbly and say, "Forgive us," so that We may forgive you. And those who do good will be rewarded.'
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ qul'nā ʾud'khulū hādhihi l-qaryata fakulū min'hā ḥaythu shi'tum raġadan wa-ud'khulū l-bāba sujjadan wa-qulū ḥiṭṭa nanġir lakum khaṭāyākum wa-sanarīdu l-muḥ'sinīn.

verses.arabic: فَبَدَّلَ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ قَوْلًا غَيْرَ الَّذِى قِيلَ لَهُمْ فَأَنزَلْنَا عَلَى الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ رِجْزًا مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْسُقُونَ
verses.english: But those who did wrong changed the word to something different from what they were told; so We sent down upon those who did wrong a punishment from the sky because they disobeyed.
verses.transliteration: Fabaḍḍala alladhīna ẓalamū qawlan ghayra alladhī qīla lahum fa-ʾanzalnā ʿala alladhīna ẓalamū rij'zan min as-samāi bimā kānū yaʿṣūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ اسْتَسْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِ فَقُلْنَا اضْرِبْ بِّعَصَاكَ الْحَجَرَ فَانفَجَرَتْ مِنْهُ اثْنَتَا عَشْرَةَ عَيْنًا ۖ قَدْ عَلِمَ كُلُّ أُنفُسٍ مَّشْرَبَهُمْ ۖ كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا مِن رِّزْقِ اللَّهِ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا فِي الْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
verses.english: And recall when Moses asked for water for his people, so We said, 'Strike the rock with your staff,' and twelve springs gushed forth from it. Each group knew its own place of drinking. Eat and drink from the provisions of Allah, and do not spread corruption on the earth.
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ istasqā mūsa li-qaw'mihi fa-ʾqul'nā iḍ'rib b-iʿaṣāka l-ḥajar, fa-infajarat min'hu ʾiʿnātun ʿash'rata ʿaynin qad ʿalima kullu ʾinsāʾi mashrabahum, kulū wa-š'rabū min riz'qi llāhi wa-lā tuʾ'thū fī l-arḍi muf'sidīna.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قُلْتُمْ يَا مُوسَىٰ لَن نَّصْبِرَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامٍ وَاحِدٍ فَادْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُخْرِجْ لَنَا مِمَّا تُنبِتُ الْأَرْضُ مِن بَقْلِهَا وَقِثَّائِهَا وَفُومِهَا وَعَدَسِهَا وَبَصَلِهَا ۖ قَالَ أَتَسْتَبْدِلُونَ الَّذِي هُوَ أَدْنَىٰ بِالَّذِي هُوَ خَيْرٌ ۚ اهْبِطُوا مِصْرًا فَإِنَّ لَكُم مَّا سَأَلْتُمْ ۗ وَضُرِبَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ الذِّلَّةُ وَالْمَسْكَنَةُ وَبَاءُوا بِغَضَبٍ مِّنَ اللَّهِ ۗ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا يَكْفُرُونَ بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ وَيَقْتُلُونَ النَّبِيِّينَ بِغَيْرِ الْحَقِّ ۗ ذَٰلِكَ بِمَا عَصَوا وَّكَانُوا يَعْتَدُونَ
verses.english: And when you said, 'O Moses, we cannot endure one kind of food; so pray to your Lord for us to bring forth for us what the earth produces—its herbs, cucumbers, wheat, lentils, and onions.' He said, 'Would you exchange what is better for what is worse? Go down to Egypt, for surely you will get what you ask for.' Humiliation and misery were stamped upon them, and they incurred the wrath of Allah. That was because they disbelieved in the signs of Allah and killed the prophets unjustly. That was for their disobedience and transgression.
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ qultum yā mūsa lan naṣ'bara ʿala ṭaʿamin wāḥidin fa-ʾdʿu lirabbika yukh'rij li-mā tun'bitu l-arḍu min baqaliha wa-qitāʾiha wa-fūmiha wa-ʿadasiha wa-baṣaliha, Qāla ʾatastaʿdilūna alladhī huwa ʾadnā ʾilā alladhī huwa khayrun, Aḥbiṭū miṣran fa-ʾinnā lakum mā saʾaltum, Wa-ḍuribat ʿalayhimu ḍ-ḍillah wa-l-mas'kahatu wa-bāʾū bi-ḍaḍa min Allāhi, Dhālikum bi-ʾannahum kānū yakfurūna bi-āyātillāhi wa-yaqtulūna an-nabiyyīna bī-ḥaqqin, Dhālikum bimā ʿaṣaw wa-kānū yaʿtadūn.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَالَّذِينَ هَادُوا وَالنَّصَارَىٰ وَالصَّابِئِينَ مَن آَمَنَ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَلَهُمْ أَجْرُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ وَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
verses.english: Indeed, those who believe, and those who are Jews, Christians, Sabians—whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day and does righteousness—will have their reward with their Lord, and there will be no fear upon them, nor will they grieve.
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna ʾāmanū wa-alladhīna hādū wa-nasārā wa-ṣābiʾīna man ʾāmana bi-llāhi wa-l-ʾākhirati wa-ʿamila ṣāliḥan falahum ʾajruhum ʿinda rabbihim wa-lā khawfun ʿalayhim wa-lā hum yaḥzanūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ أَخَذْنَا مِيثَاقَكُمْ وَرَفَعْنَا فَوْقَكُمُ الطُّورَ خُذُوا مَا آتَيْنَاكُم بِقُوَّةٍ وَاذْكُرُوا مَا فِيهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَّقُونَ
verses.english: And recall when We took your covenant and raised above you the mount, [saying], 'Hold fast to what We have given you and remember what is in it so that you may become mindful.'
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ ʾakhadhnā mīthāqakum wa-rafāʿnā fawqakumu ṭ-ṭūra ʾiḍ'h'khulū bihi qūwatan wa-ʾdh'kuru mā fīhi laʿallakum tattaqūn.

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ تَوَلَّيْتُم مِّن بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ فَلَوْلَا فَضْلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ وَرَحْمَتُهُ لَكُنتُم مِّنَ الْخَاسِرِينَ
verses.english: Then, after that, you turned away. Had it not been for Allah's grace and mercy upon you, you would have surely been among the losers.
verses.transliteration: Thumma tawallaytum min baʿdī dhālik, falawlā faḍlu llāhi ʿalaykum wa-raḥmatuhu la-kuntum mina l-khāsirīn.

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْتُمُ الَّذِينَ اعْتَدَوْا مِنكُمْ فِي السَّبْتِ فَقُلْنَا لَهُمْ كُونُوا قِرَدَةً خَاسِئِينَ
verses.english: And certainly you know those among you who violated the Sabbath, so We said to them, 'Be as apes, despised.'
verses.transliteration: Wa-laqad ʿalim'tumu alladhīna ʿtaḍaw min'kum fī as-sabti fa-ʾqul'nā lahum kōnū qiradatan ḵāsʾiʾīn.

verses.arabic: فَجَعَلْنَاهَا نَكَالًا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهَا وَمَا خَلْفَهَا وَمَوْعِظَةً لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.english: So We made it a lesson for those who fear God and a warning for those who are mindful.
verses.transliteration: Fajaʿalnāhā nikālan limā bayna yadayhā wa-mā khalfahā wa-mawʿiẓatan lilmutaqīn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَأْمُرُكُم أَنْ تَذْبَحُوا بَقَرَةً ۖ قَالُوا أَتَتَّخِذُنَا هُزُوًا ۖ قَالَ أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ أَنْ أَكُونَ مِنَ الْجَاهِلِينَ
verses.english: And when Moses said to his people, 'Indeed, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow,' they said, 'Are you making fun of us?' He said, 'I seek refuge in Allah from being among the ignorant.'
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ qāla mūsa li-qaw'mihi ʾinna llāha yaʾmurukum ʾan tadh'bḥū baqaratan, Qālū ʾatattakhidhunā huzūan, Qāla ʾaʿūdhu bi-llāhi ʾan ʾakūna mina l-jāhilīn.

verses.arabic: قَالُوا ادْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُبَيِّن لَّنَا مَا هِيَ ۚ قَالَ إِنَّهُ يَقُولُ إِنَّهَا بَقَرَةٌ لَّا فَارِضٌ وَلَا بِكْرٌ عَوَانٌ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ فَافْعَلُوا مَا تُؤْمَرُونَ
verses.english: They said, 'Call upon your Lord to make clear to us what it is.' He said, 'He says, it is a cow neither old nor young, but of middle age. Do as you are commanded.'
verses.transliteration: Qālū ʾidʿu lanā rabbaka yubayyinu lanā mā hiya, Qāla ʾinnahū yaqūlu ʾinnahā baqaratun lā farīḍun wa-lā bikrun ʿawānun bayna dhāliku fa-ʿmalū mā tu'marūn.

verses.arabic: قَالُوا ادْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُبَيِّن لَّنَا مَا لَوْنُهَا ۚ قَالَ إِنَّهُ يَقُولُ إِنَّهَا بَقَرَةٌ صَفْرَاءُ فَاقِعٌ لَّوْنُهَا تَسُرُّ النَّاظِرِينَ
verses.english: They said, 'Call upon your Lord to clarify for us its color.' He said, 'He says, it is a yellow cow, bright in color, pleasing to the beholders.'
verses.transliteration: Qālū ʾidʿu lanā rabbaka yubayyinu lanā mā lwānuhā, Qāla ʾinnahu yaqūlu ʾinnahā baqaratun ṣaf'rāʾu faqīʿun lwānuhā tasurru an-ẓādirīn.

verses.arabic: قَالُوا ادْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُبَيِّن لَّنَا مَا هِيَ إِنَّ الْبَقَرَ تَشَابَهَ عَلَيْنَا وَإِنَّا إِن شَاءَ اللَّهُ لَمُهْتَدُونَ
verses.english: They said, 'Call upon your Lord to clarify for us what it is.' He said, 'He says, it is a cow neither old nor young, of middle age. Do as you are commanded.'
verses.transliteration: Qālū ʾidʿu lanā rabbaka yubayyinu lanā mā hiya, ʾinna l-baqarata tashābaha ʿalaynā, wa-ʾinnā ʾin shāʾa llāhu lamuh'tadūn.

verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّهُ يَقُولُ إِنَّهَا بَقَرَةٌ لَّا ذَلُولٌ تُثِيرُ الْأَرْضَ وَلَا تَسْقِي الْحَرْثَ مُسَلَّمَةٌ لَّا شِيَةَ فِيهَا ۚ قَالُوا الْآنَ جِئْتَ بِالْحَقِّ ۚ فَذَبَحُوهَا وَمَا كَادُوا يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.english: He said, 'He says, it is a cow not tame, neither old nor young, of middle age, with no blemish in it.' They said, 'Now you have come with the truth.' So they slaughtered it, though they almost did not do it.
verses.transliteration: Qāla ʾinnahu yaqūlu ʾinnahā baqaratun lā dhalūlun tuthīru l-arḍa walā tasqī l-ḥarṣa musallamatun lā shīyata fīhā, Qālū ʾal-ʾānajit'ta bīl-ḥaqqi, Fa-ḏabḥūhā wa-mā kādū yafʿalūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ قَتَلْتُمْ نَفْسًا فَادَّارَأْتُمْ فِيهَا ۖ وَاللَّهُ مُخْرِجٌ مَّا كُنتُمْ تَكْتُمُونَ
verses.english: And when you murdered a soul and disputed over it, but Allah was to bring out what you concealed.
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ qatal'tum nafsan fa-ʾdāraʾtum fīhā, wa-llāhu mukh'rijun mā kuntum tak'tumūn.

verses.arabic: فَقُلْنَا ʾٱ ʾضْرِبُوا ʾبَعْضَهَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُحْيِي اللَّهُ الْمَوْتَىٰ وَيُرِيكُمْ آيَاتِهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.english: So We said, 'Strike the slain body with a piece of it.' So Allah brought the dead to life and showed you His signs that you might understand.
verses.transliteration: Fāqul'nā ʾiḍ'ribū ʾabʿaḍahu, Kaḏālik yuḥ'yī llāhu l-mawta wa-yurīkum ʾāyātihi laʿallakum taʿqilūn.

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ قَسَتْ قُلُوبُكُم مِّن بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ فَهِيَ كَالْحِجَارَةِ أَوْ أَشَدُّ قَسْوَةً ۚ وَإِنَّ مِنَ الْحِجَارَةِ لَمَا يَتَفَجَّرُ مِنْهُ الْأَنْهَارُ ۚ وَإِنَّ مِنْهَا لَمَا يَشَّقَّقُ فَيَخْرُجُ مِنْهُ الْمَاءُ ۚ وَإِنَّ مِنْهَا لَمَا يَهْبِطُ مِنْ خَشْيَةِ اللَّهِ ۗ وَمَا اللَّهُ بِغَافِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.english: Then your hearts became hardened like stones or even harder. Among stones are some from which rivers flow, others split open and water comes out, others fall down for fear of Allah. And Allah is not unaware of what you do.
verses.transliteration: Thumma qasat qulubukum min baʿdi dhālik fahiyā kal-ḥijārati ʾaw ʾashaddu qaswatun wa-inna mina l-ḥijārati lama yatafajjaru min'hu l-ʾanāru wa-inna mina mā yashqaqu fayaḵruju min'hu l-māu wa-inna mina mā yabhatu min ḵashyatillāhi wa-mā llāhu bighāfilin ʿammā taʿmalūn.

verses.arabic: فَأَتَطْمَعُونَ أَن يُؤْمِنُوا لَكُمْ وَقَدْ كَانَ فَرِيقٌ مِّنْهُم يَسْمَعُونَ كَلَامَ اللَّهِ ثُمَّ يُحَرِّفُونَهُ مِن بَعْدِ مَا عَقَلُوهُ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.english: Do you hope that they will believe in you, when a party of them used to hear the words of Allah and then distort them knowingly?
verses.transliteration: Fa-ʾataṭmaʿūna ʾan yu'minū laka wa-qad kāna firaqun min'hum yasmaʿūna kalāma llāhi thumma yuharrifūnahu min baʿdi mā ʿaqalūhu wa-hum yaʿlamūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا لَقُوا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا قَالُوا آمَنَّا وَإِذَا خَلَوْا عَضُّوا عَلَيْكُمُ الْأَنَامِلَ مِنَ الْغِيظِ ۚ قُلْ مَاتَ عِندَ اللَّهِ مِنْ خَيْرٍ ۖ يُؤْتِيكُمْ خَيْرًا مِّنْ مَّا أُخْفُوا۟ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَحْدِيمُ مَيْنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: When they meet the believers, they say, 'We believe'; but when they are alone with their evil companions, they say, 'We are with you; we were only mocking.' Allah mocks them and leaves them to wander blindly in their rebellion.
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏā laqū l-ḏīna ʾāmanū qālū ʾāmanā wa-ʾiḏā khalaw ʿala ʾiḍ'ḥābihim qālū ʾaḥāṣibu ʿalaykum, yastahziʾūn bi-llāhi wa-hum bihi yastahziʾūn.

verses.arabic: أَلَمْ يَعْلَمُوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
verses.english: Do they not know that Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare?
verses.transliteration: ʾAlam yaʿlamū ʾanna llāha yaʿlamu mā yusir'rūna wa-mā yūʿ'linūn.

verses.arabic: مِنْهُم أُمِّيُّونَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ الْكِتَابَ إِلَّا أَمَانِيَّ وَإِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا يَظُنُّونَ
verses.english: Among them are the illiterates who do not know the Book except through wishful thinking, and they only guess.
verses.transliteration: Min'hum umiyyūn lā yaʿlamūna l-kitāba ʾillā ʾamāniyy wa-ʾinnahum ʾilā yadhunnūn.

verses.arabic: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ يَكْتُبُونَ الْكِتَابَ بِأَيْدِيهِمْ ثُمَّ يَقُولُونَ هَٰذَا مِنْ عِندِ اللَّهِ لِيَشْتَرُوا بِهِ ثَمَنًا قَلِيلًا ۖ فَوَيْلٌ لَّهُم مِّمَّا كَتَبَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَوَيْلٌ لَّهُم مِّمَّا يَكْسِبُونَ
verses.english: So woe to those who write the Book with their own hands and then say, 'This is from Allah,' to exchange it for a small price. Woe to them for what their hands have written, and woe to them for what they earn.
verses.transliteration: Fawwaylun lilladhīna yaktubūna l-kitāba bi-ʾaydīhim thumma yaqūlūna hādhā min ʿindi llāhi liyashtarū bihi thamanan qalīlan, Fawwaylun lahum mimmā katabat ʾaydīhim wa-waylun lahum mimmā yaksibūn.

verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا لَن تَمَسَّنَا النَّارُ إِلَّا أَيَّامًا مَّعْدُودَةً ۚ قُلْ أَتَّخَذْتُمْ عِندَ اللَّهِ عَهْدًا فَلَن يُخْلِفَ اللَّهُ عَهْدَهُ ۖ أَمْ تَقُولُونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.english: And they say, 'The Fire will not touch us except for a few days.' Say, 'Have you received a promise from Allah? Then Allah will not break His promise. Or do you say about Allah what you do not know?'
verses.transliteration: Wa-qālū lan tamassana an- nāru ʾillā ʾayyāma maʿdūdātin, Qul ʾatakhadhtum ʿinda llāhi ʿahdan falan yukh'lifa llāhu ʿahdahu, ʾam taqūlūna ʿala llāhi mā lā taʿlamūn.

verses.arabic: بَلَىٰ مَن كَسَبَ سَيِّئَةً وَأَحَاطَتْ بِهِ خَطِيئَتُهُ فَأُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ النَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ
verses.english: Yes, whoever earns evil and his sin has encompassed him—those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein forever.
verses.transliteration: Balā man kasaba sayyiʾatan wa-aḥāṭat bihi khaṭīʾatuhu fa-ʾulāʾika aṣḥābu n-nāri hum fīhā khālidūn.

verses.arabic: وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ أُوْلَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ الْجَنَّةِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ
verses.english: But those who believe and do righteous deeds—they are the companions of Paradise; they will abide therein forever.
verses.transliteration: Wa-alladhīna ʾāmanū wa-ʿamilū aṣ-ṣāliḥāti ʾulāʾika aṣḥābu l-jannah hum fīhā khālidūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ أَخَذْنَا مِيثَاقَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ لَا تَعْبُدُونَ إِلَّا اللَّهَ وَبِالْوَالِدَيْنِ إِحْسَانًا وَذِي الْقُرْبَىٰ وَالْيَتَامَىٰ وَالْمَسَاكِينِ وَقُولُوا لِلنَّاسِ حُسْنًا وَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكَاةَ ثُمَّ تَوَلَّيْتُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا مِّنكُمْ وَأَنتُم مُّعْرِضُونَ
verses.english: And [recall] when We took the covenant from the Children of Israel, [enjoining upon them], 'Do not worship except Allah; and to parents do good and to relatives, orphans, and the needy. And speak to people good [words] and establish prayer and give zakah.' Then you turned away, except a few of you, and you were refusing.
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ ʾakhadhnā mīthāqakum lā taʿbūdūna ʾillā llāha wa-bi-l-wālidaini ʾiḥ'sānan wa-ḏī l-qur'bā wa-l-yatāmā wa-l-masākīna wa-qūlū li-n-nāsi ḥus'nā wa-ʾaqīmū ṣ-ṣalāṭa wa-ʾātū z-zakāta thumma tawallaytum ʾillā qīlān minkum wa-ʾantum muʿ'riḍūn.

verses.arabic: ثُمَّ أَنتُمْ هَٰؤُلَاءِ تَقْتُلُونَ أَنفُسَكُمْ وَتُخْرِجُونَ فَرِيقًا مِّنكُم مِّن دِّيَارِهِمْ تَظَاهَرُونَ عَلَيْهِم بِالإثْمِ وَالْعُدْوَانِ ۚ وَإِن يُطَاقُوكُمْ يُخْرِجُوكُمْ مِنْ أَرْضِكُمْ وَيَخْرُجُونَ أَنفُسَهُمْ وَأَشْحَصَتِ الْقُلُوبُ ۚ وَتَحْسَبُونَهُمْ جَمِيعًا وَقُلُوبُهُمْ شَتَّىٰ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَوْمٌ لَّا يَعْقِلُونَ
verses.english: And you are those who kill one another and evict a party of your people from their homes, supporting one another against them in sin and aggression. And if they come to you as captives, you ransom them, although their expulsion was forbidden to you. So do you believe in part of the Scripture and disbelieve in part? Then what is the recompense for those who do that among you except disgrace in worldly life; and on the Day of Resurrection they will be sent back to the severest punishment. And Allah is not unaware of what you do
verses.transliteration: Thumma ʾantum hāʾulāʾi taqtulūna ʾanfusakum wa-tukh'rijūna farīqan minkum min ḏiyārīhim tazāḥarūna ʿalayhim b-iʾth'mi wa-l-ʿud'wāni, wa-in yutāwūkumu yukh'rijūkum min ʾarḍiikum wa-yakh'rujūna ʾanfusahum wa-ʾašḥāṣat ʾal-qulūb, wa-taḥsabuḥum jamīʿan wa-qulūbuhum shattā, ḏālikum bi-ʾannahum qawmun lā yaʿqilūn.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ اشْتَرَوُا الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا بِالْآخِرَةِ لَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنْهُمُ الْعَذَابُ وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
verses.english: Indeed, those who purchase the life of this world at the expense of the Hereafter will not be eased of the punishment, nor will they be aided.
verses.transliteration: Inna alladhīna is'taraw al-ḥayāṭa ad-dun'yā bil-ākhirati lā yukh'faʿ ʿanhumu l-ʿadhābu wa-lā hum yunṣarūn.

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى الْكِتَابَ وَقَفَّيْنَا مِن بَعْدِهِ بِالرُّسُلِ ۖ وَآتَيْنَا عِيسَى ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ الْبَيِّنَاتِ وَأَيَّدْنَاهُ بِرُوحِ الْقُدُسِ ۗ أَفَكُلَّمَا جَاءَكُمْ رَسُولٌ بِمَا لَا تَهْوَىٰ أَنفُسُكُمُ اسْتَكْبَرْتُمْ فَفَرِيقًا كَذَّبْتُمْ وَفَرِيقًا تَقْتُلُونَ
verses.english: And We gave Moses the Scripture and followed him with messengers. And We gave Jesus, the son of Mary, clear signs and strengthened him with the Holy Spirit. But when a messenger came to you with what your souls did not desire, you were arrogant, and some of them you denied, and others you killed.
verses.transliteration: Wa-laqad ʾātaynā mūsa l-kitāba wa-qaffaynā min baʿdihi birusuli, wa-ʾātaynā ʿīsā ibn maryama l-bayyināti wa-ʾayyadnāhu birūḥi l-qudusi. ʾAfakullamā jāʾakum rasūlun bīmā lā taḥbā ʾan'fusukum ʾistakbar'tum fa-farīqān kadhabtum wa-farīqān taqtulūn.

verses.arabic: وَقَالُوا قُلُوبُنَا غُلْفٌ ۚ بَلْ لَّعَنَهُمُ اللَّهُ بِكُفْرِهِمْ فَقَلِيلًا مَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.english: And they say, 'Our hearts are wrapped.' No, Allah has cursed them for their disbelief; so little is that which they believe.
verses.transliteration: Wa-qālū qulubunā ghul'fun bal laʿanahumu llāhu bikuf'rihim fa-qalīlun mā yu'minūn.

verses.arabic: وَلَمَّا جَاءَهُم مِّمَّا عَرَفُوا كَفَرُوا بِهِ فَاللَّعْنَةُ عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ
verses.english: And when a sign comes to them from Allah that they recognize, they disbelieve in it. So the curse of Allah is upon the disbelievers.
verses.transliteration: Wa-lammā jāʾahum mimmā ʿarafū kafarū bihi fa-llʿanatu ʿala l-kāfirīn.

verses.arabic: بِئْسَمَا اشْتَرَوْا بِهِ أَنفُسَهُمْ أَن يَكْفُرُوا بِمَا أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ بَغْيًا أَن يُنَزِّلَ اللَّهُ مِن فَضْلِهِ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَاءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ ۖ فَبَاءُوا بِغَضَبٍ عَلَىٰ غَضَبٍ ۚ وَلِلْكَافِرِينَ عَذَابٌ مُّهِينٌ
verses.english: Evil is what they have sold themselves for, because they disbelieved in what Allah revealed, out of envy that Allah bestows His bounty upon whom He wills from among His servants. So they earned Allah's wrath. For the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.
verses.transliteration: Biʾsama is'tarāʾū bihi anfusakum ʾan yakfurū bīmā ʾanzala llāhu bighaḍbin ʾan yunazzila llāhu min faḍlihi ʿala man yashāʾu min ʿibādihi, fabaʾū bighaḍabin ʿala ʾaḍaḍ, wa-lil'kāfirīna ʿadhābun muhīnun.

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ آمِنُوا بِمَا أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ قَالُوا نُؤْمِنُ بِمَا أُنزِلَ عَلَيْنَا وَيَكْفُرُونَ بِمَا وَرَاءَهُ ۖ وَهُوَ الْحَقُّ مُصَدِّقًا لِّمَا مَعَهُمْ ۗ قُلْ فَلِمَ تَقْتُلُونَ أَنبِيَاءَ اللَّهِ مِن قَبْلُ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: And when it is said to them, 'Believe in what Allah has revealed,' they say, 'We believe in what was revealed to us.' And they disbelieve in what came after it, although it is the truth confirming what is with them. Say, 'Then why did you kill the prophets of Allah before, if you are believers?'
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ qīla lahum ʾāminū bimā ʾanzala llāhu qālū naʾmā ʾāmannā wa-ʾaṣḍarrafūna ʿani l-ʾāyāti wa-ʾahum ʾiḍ'ʿāʾu ʾalqawāma, qul fa-limā taqtulūna ʾanbiyāʾa llāhi min qablu in kutum mu'minīn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ آمنُّوا بِمَا أَنزَلَ اللَّهُ قَالُوا نُؤْمِنُ بِمَا أُنزِلَ عَلَيْنَا وَيَكْفُرُونَ بِمَا وَرَاءَهُ وَهُوَ الْحَقُّ مُصَدِّقًا لِّمَا مَعَهُمْ ۗ قُلْ فَلِمَ تَقْتُلُونَ أَنبِيَاءَ اللَّهِ مِن قَبْلُ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: And when it is said to them, 'Believe in what Allah has revealed,' they say, 'We believe only in what is ours.' And they disbelieve in what came after it, and it is the truth confirming what is with them. Say, 'Then why did you kill the prophets of Allah before, if you are believers?'
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ qīla lahum ʾāminū bimā ʾanzala llāhu qālū naʾmā ʾāmannā wa-ʾaṣḍarrafūna ʿani l-ʾāyāti wa-ʾahum ʾiḍ'ʿāʾu ʾalqawāma, qul fa-limā taqtulūna ʾanbiyāʾa llāhi min qablu in kutum mu'minīn.

verses.arabic: بَلَٰى مَن كَسَبَ سَيِّئَةً وَأَحَاطَتْ بِهِ خَطِيئَتُهُ فَأُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ النَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ
verses.english: Yes, whoever earns evil and his sin has encompassed him—those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein forever.
verses.transliteration: Balā man kasaba sayyiʾatan wa-aḥāṭat bihi khaṭīʾatuhu fa-ʾulāʾika aṣḥābu n-nāri hum fīhā khālidūn.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ أَخَذْنَا مِيثَاقَكُمْ وَرَفَعْنَا فَوْقَكُمُ الطُّورَ خُذُوا مَا آتَيْنَاكُم بِقُوَّةٍ وَاسْمَعُوا ۖ قَالُوا سَمِعْنَا وَعَصَيْنَا ۚ وَأُشْرِبُوا فِي قُلُوبِهِمُ الْعِجْلَ بِكُفْرِهِمْ ۚ قُلْ بِئْسَمَا يَأْمُرُكُم بِهِ إِيمَانُكُمْ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: And recall when We took your covenant and raised the mountain above you, saying, 'Hold fast to what We have given you and listen.' They said, 'We hear and disobey.' And their hearts absorbed the worship of the calf because of their disbelief. Say, 'Evil is what your faith enjoins upon you if you are believers.'
verses.transliteration: Wa-ʾiḏ ʾakhadhnā mīthāqakum wa-rafaʿnā fawqakumu ṭūra ḵhuḍū mā ʾātaynākum bi-quwwatin wa-is'maʿū. Qālū samiʿ'nā wa-ʿaṣaynā, wa-ʾush'ribū fī qulubihimu ʿil'jalla bikuf'rihim. Quli biʾsa mā yaʾmurukum bihi ʾīmānikum in kuntum mu'minīn.

verses.arabic: قُلْ إِن كَانَتْ لَكُمُ الدَّارُ الْآخِرَةُ عِندَ اللَّهِ خَالِصَةً مِّن دُونِ النَّاسِ فَتَمَنَّوُا الْمَوْتَ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.english: Say, 'If the home of the Hereafter with Allah is for you alone and not for mankind, then wish for death if you should be truthful.'
verses.transliteration: Quli in kānat lakumu ad-dāru l-ʾākhirati ʿinda llāhi khāliṣatan min dūni n-nāsi fata-mannaw l-mawta in kun'tum ṣādiqīn.

verses.arabic: فَلَن يَتَمَنَّوْهُ أَبَدًا بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِالظَّالِمِينَ
verses.english: But they will never wish for it because of what their hands have put forth. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
verses.transliteration: Falan yata-mannāhu ʾabadan bimā qaddamat ʾaydīhim, wa-llāhu ʿalīmun bil-ẓālimīn.

verses.arabic: وَلَتَجِدَنَّهُمْ أَحْرَصَ النَّاسِ عَلَىٰ حَيَاةٍ وَمِنَ الَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا ۚ يَوَدُّ أَحَدُهُمْ لَوْ يُعَمَّرُ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ ۖ وَمَا هُوَ بِمُزَحْزِحِهِ مِنَ الْعَذَابِ أَن يُعَمَّرَ ۗ وَاللَّهُ بَصِيرٌ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.english: And you will surely find them the most eager of people for life, even more than those who associate others with Allah. Every one of them wishes he could live a thousand years, but it will not remove him in the least from the punishment. And Allah is Seeing of what they do.
verses.transliteration: Wa-latajidannahum ʾaḥrāṣa n-nāsi ʿala ḥayāh wa-min alladhīna sharikū, yawaddu ʾaḥaduhum law yuh'ḍā ʾalfa sanatan wa-mā huwa bi-muzḥiḥ'hi min al-ʿadhābi an yuh'ḍā, wa-llāhu baṣīrun bīmā yaʿmalūn.

verses.arabic: قُلْ مَن كَانَ عَدُوًّا لِّجِبْرِيلَ فَإِنَّهُ نَزَّلَهُ عَلَىٰ قَلْبِكَ بِإِذْنِ اللَّهِ مُصَدِّقًا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ وَهُدًى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: Say, 'Whoever is an enemy to Gabriel—for he has brought the Qur'an down upon your heart by permission of Allah, confirming what came before it and guidance and good news for the believers.'
verses.transliteration: Quli man kāna ʿaduwwan li-jibrīl, fa-ʾinnahu nazzalahu ʿala qalbika bi-ʾid'ni llāhi muṣaddiqan lima bayna yadayhi wa-hudan wa-bush'ran lil'mu'minīn.

verses.arabic: مَن كَانَ عَدُوًّا لِّلَّهِ وَمَلَائِكَتِهِ وَرُسُلِهِ وَجِبْرِيلَ وَمِيكَالَ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ عَدُوٌّ لِّلْكَافِرِينَ
verses.english: Whoever is an enemy to Allah, His angels, His messengers, Gabriel, and Michael— then indeed, Allah is an enemy to the disbelievers.
verses.transliteration: Man kāna ʿaduwwan li-llāhi wa-malaʾikatihi wa-rrusuli wa-jibrīla wa-mīkāla, fa-ʾinna llāha ʿaduwwun lil'kāfirīn.

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَنزَلْنَا إِلَيْكَ آيَاتٍ بَيِّنَاتٍ ۖ وَمَا يَكْفُرُ بِهَا إِلَّا الْفَاسِقُونَ
verses.english: And We have certainly sent down to you clear signs, and none disbelieves in them except the defiantly disobedient.
verses.transliteration: Wa-laqad ʾanzalnā ilayka āyātin bayyinātin wa-mā yakfurū bīhā ʾillā l-fāsiqūn.

verses.arabic: أَوَكُلَّمَا عَاهَدُوا عَهْدًا نَّبَذَهُ فَرِيقٌ مِّنْهُم ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.english: Whenever they make a covenant, a party of them cast it aside; but most of them do not believe.
verses.transliteration: Aw kullamā ʿāhadū ʿahdan nabaðahu fareequn min'hum, bal aktharuhum lā yu'minūn.
